newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil shares end little changed, absorb losses.
newsitem.headline: Brazil shares end little changed, absorb losses.

text.p: Brazil shares ended little changed on Monday after trading lower for most of the session, with investors cutting positions in Telebras and moving into power, oil and mining stocks, brokers said.
The Sao Paulo's Bovespa index comprising the 47 most traded stocks closed up 0.06 percent at 13,502 points.
Market turnover totalled 742.2 million reais ($693.6 million), slightly lower than the bolsa's recent daily average of between 800 million reais and over one billion reais.
"Investors took profits on Telebras, but bought other blue-chips," said a senior trader.
Telebras preferred fell 0.51 percent, closing at 175 reais, but Eletrobras, Vale do Rio Doce and Petrobras ended firmer.
Eletrobras preferred jumped 2.39 percent, ending at 727 reais. Petrobras preferred rose 1.94 percent to 315 reais, while Vale preferred gained 2.49 percent to end at 29.20 reais.

Traders said Eletrobras continued climbing on news that the company is considering a share split and bright privatization prospects. Later this month, the northeastern state of Bahia will privatize its power utility Coelba.
